solution_line_template: The sandbox is {sandbox_length}' long, {sandbox_width}' wide so the sq footage of the sandbox is {sandbox_length}*{sandbox_width} = <<{sandbox_length}*{sandbox_width}={sandbox_sq_ft}>>{sandbox_sq_ft} sq ft

He needs {sandbox_sq_ft} sq ft of sand to fill the sandbox and he can buy it in {bag_sq_ft} sq ft bags so he needs {sandbox_sq_ft}/{bag_sq_ft} = <<{sandbox_sq_ft}/{bag_sq_ft}={num_bags}>>{num_bags} bags of sand
The sand costs ${bag_cost} a bag and he needs {num_bags} bags so it will cost him {bag_cost}*{num_bags} = $<<{bag_cost}*{num_bags}={total_cost}>>{total_cost} in sand
